title: Sampler, 1825
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation 
Technique: embroidered in satin, cross, stem, chain, and buttonhole stitches on plain weave foundation
inscribed:
Elizabeth Wiert Aged 80 Died 1825 
Margaret Moss Aged 11 1825
provenance:
By 1941, Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
1941 - 1974, Rosalie Coe 
1974, Cooper-Hewitt Museum
creditline: Bequest of Rosalie Coe, from the collection inherited from her mother, Eva Johnston Coe
description: Inside a scrolling floral vine border, a rural landscape with a large house, weeping willow trees, a shepherd with a flock of sheep, cows, ducks, a beehive, children playing and a man and woman strolling.  Above the house is a large eagle with a banner reading "E Pluribus Unum," flanked by two cartouches with inscriptions.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1825.
1825. Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation 
Technique: embroidered in satin, cross, stem, chain, and buttonhole stitches on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Rosalie Coe, from the collection inherited from her mother, Eva Johnston Coe. 1974-42-8.
